title: The problems with league as I see it.
body:
A lot of champions are fundamentally broken, In that when they are viable they are incredibly unfun to play against, and when they aren't they are incredibly unfun to play.

It almost feels like this game wasn't designed around having a pvp element in it, like that was a secondary feature, and the primary feature was some sort of co-op game.
Maybe the real mode was co-op vs ai the whole time, and pvp is just a secondary feature.

> And also, i also apologize for that first post. Ive started rank with the preseason placements,and tired of being flamed for making mistakes.

This argument is just plain flawed, I don't know why it is so popular. Many low elo players don't even play champions to half their potential (at least for the mechanically intensive champions) so the balancing would be extremely skewed in favour of champions that are harder to learn and against easy champions. This in turn would completely fuck over challenger elo because they play champions to near maximum potential and thus the power discrepancy between champions will be black and white. You can climb out of low elo simply by getting better at the game, completely regardless of how the game is balanced. Challenger players, on the other hand, cannot get better (very marginally better) so balance is the determining factor of winning up there. And if riot listened to even half the suggestions made on these boards, this game would be exponentially worse across all elos.
